>The car I mentioned, the Alfa Romeo Grand Sport, looks similar to the Benz 300 SSK.
>According to a book I have on the TV series, not the first, I think the second. The car is a
>Alfa Romeo Grand Sport 1930; it has a nice fold out poster with hand drawn pictures of it
>and the Fiat 500. Personally from the pics below, I can only remember seeing the Alfa;
>does the SSK resemble the one pictured below?

Sure does.  If I didn't see a side-by-side comparison of the two cars I probably would have considered them to be the same car (they are superficially similar).  I guess they didn't use it after the First TV series. 

Come to think of it, a lot of things changed from first series to the second, off the top of my head:

-Jigen's gun originally was a double action Colt, later a 357 Magnum (he has gone back to a double action style pistol recently)

-Lupin's silver-engraved Walther P-38 became the flat black model (there's two somewhat contradictory stories about how he lost the original Walther)

-Inspector Zenegata joining Interpol, and the series becomes more international

-We see less of the private lives of the cast in the second series, eg. the hideout that Lupin and Jigen share, and their various 'cover' jobs (eg.  Jigen runs a gun shop)

-the 'relationship' that Fujiko and Goemon share is more subdued or just plain forgotten in later stories (except maybe Twilight Gemini).  Goemon was originally introduced as a villian and as a rival for Fujiko's affections.

-the first series stories are more similar in tone to the original manga.  Lupin is less of a hero and more of a true criminal (while still being 'cool gevalt')

As for the site I maintain, I don't have one!  Never got around to making my own web pages... maybe I should.   In the meantime, I should get someone to host the Lupin in English FAQ :-)



Regards,

Rob S.
